Welcome

About me

Growing up I learned about life with a soccer ball at my feet. Soccer taught me all about leadership, teamwork and perseverance but most importantly, how to overcome and deal with failure. As I grew up I knew that I wanted to pursue a career that was closely related to soccer, which is why I am driven towards computer science. My goal is to invent new softwares and computer programs - innovations that will have an impact on the way people interact with and use technology in their everyday lives. Being a soccer player and embodying the qualities of creativity, passion, and being able to think outside the box have well positioned me to be an innovator.

I enjoy coaching soccer, learning about Artificial Intelligence and watching soccer all day when I am not behind a computer screen.

View Resume

Projects

Find-IT-BookStore

Created a responsive application using JavaScript that connects to an API that renders Computer Science books searched by the user. Deployed the site using Github pages and used github control flow to keep track of development for future post MVP features. The site includes advanced CSS topics such as flexbox to display elements in a organized manner

See Live Source Code

MERN E-commerce/React Application

Worked in a group of three teammates to create an e-commerce application using React JS that mimics the selling of eco-friendly items, using components to efficiently re-render our page when data changes Incorporated user authentication through JWT and created our own database that connects to MongoDB Created API endpoint routes so that the server performs CRUD operations while connecting Backend with Frontend using mongoose, express and axios libraries itaque molestiae.

See Live Source Code

FootieClub/React Application

Built react components and used AirTable API to create a social media styled application for soccer fans to interact with eachother. Deployed and Hosted web application on Netlify

See Live Source Code

The Back IV/React Application

Created a blog application using React that connects to a PostgreSQL database built on Ruby on Rails. Implemented user authentication and full CRUD functionality while deploying application to Netlify

See Live Source Code

The Adventure of the Revenge of Pasquale/Unity3D Game

Created a 2D-side scrolling game using Unity3D, Visual Studio and C# as the primary language Worked in a group to create our own Art and animations inside Unity3D along with 20 scripts that include player movement, enemy movement, player interaction with the game environment and all other physical aspects of the game. The game has a menu and cut scenes through the level and dialogues between characters

See Live Source Code
